title: Hamas Leader Killed in Gaza Fighting, Israel Says
content: The Israeli military confirmed that Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, was killed on Wednesday. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he spoke with President Biden about working to advance a deal “to free the hostages.”
summary: The Israeli military confirmed that Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, was killed on Wednesday. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he spoke with President Biden about working to advance a deal “to free the hostages.”

title: What Yahya Sinwar’s Death Could Mean for the Gaza Cease-Fire Talks
content: The killing of Hamas’s leader may allow Israel to claim victory and agree to a cease-fire, and new Hamas leadership could be more open to compromise. But neither side is likely to immediately change course.
summary: The killing of Hamas’s leader may allow Israel to claim victory and agree to a cease-fire, and new Hamas leadership could be more open to compromise. But neither side is likely to immediately change course.

title: Biden Prepares Quick, Rescheduled Visit to Germany, a Key Ally
content: The president’s hastily rescheduled trip to Berlin will last less than a day. The German government has trimmed back its celebrations accordingly.
summary: The president’s hastily rescheduled trip to Berlin will last less than a day. The German government has trimmed back its celebrations accordingly.

title: Meloni’s Balancing Act: Centrist Abroad, Right Wing at Home
content: New policies on surrogate births and the treatment of asylum seekers, while largely symbolic, are designed to shore up her right-wing flank in Italy, analysts say.
summary: New policies on surrogate births and the treatment of asylum seekers, while largely symbolic, are designed to shore up her right-wing flank in Italy, analysts say.

title: Egypt Replaces Its Powerful Spy Chief, a Key Gaza Mediator
content: Gen. Abbas Kamel, a longtime confidant of Egypt’s president, oversaw the country’s most important international relationships and helped maintain the president’s authoritarian grip.
summary: Gen. Abbas Kamel, a longtime confidant of Egypt’s president, oversaw the country’s most important international relationships and helped maintain the president’s authoritarian grip.

title: Gazans So Malnourished That They Could Face Famine, Report Warns
content: A hunger emergency has affected nearly all of Gaza, but the situation is worst for people in the north, where Israeli forces intensified operations this month, the report said.
summary: A hunger emergency has affected nearly all of Gaza, but the situation is worst for people in the north, where Israeli forces intensified operations this month, the report said.

title: Alone in the Dark: The Nightmare of Bangladesh’s Secret Underground Prison
content: In the House of Mirrors, political captives were pushed to the brink of insanity and death. Some are telling their stories now that the woman who put them there, Sheikh Hasina, is gone.
summary: In the House of Mirrors, political captives were pushed to the brink of insanity and death. Some are telling their stories now that the woman who put them there, Sheikh Hasina, is gone.

title: Zelensky Outlines Ukraine’s ‘Victory Plan’ to EU Leaders
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent plea in Brussels, though it’s unclear to what extent the officials gathered there will go along with it.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent plea in Brussels, though it’s unclear to what extent the officials gathered there will go along with it.

title: Indian Doctors Go on Hunger Strike to Protest Killing of Colleague
content: Six were subsisting only on water and were admitted into the hospital after a multiday fast to demand justice for the brutal rape and killing of a medical resident.
summary: Six were subsisting only on water and were admitted into the hospital after a multiday fast to demand justice for the brutal rape and killing of a medical resident.

title: Moscow Roils a Country on the Edge of Europe and Russia
content: Russia is behind a disinformation campaign in Moldova ahead of a presidential election and a referendum making E.U. membership a “strategic objective,” Moldovan officials and global media companies say.
summary: Russia is behind a disinformation campaign in Moldova ahead of a presidential election and a referendum making E.U. membership a “strategic objective,” Moldovan officials and global media companies say.

title: Peru Pañamarca Archaeological Site Finds ‘Hall of the Braided Serpents’
content: Archaeologists have unearthed a richly decorated throne room and a “Hall of the Braided Serpents” from the Moche culture, with clues that a woman may have ruled there more than 1,300 years ago.
summary: Archaeologists have unearthed a richly decorated throne room and a “Hall of the Braided Serpents” from the Moche culture, with clues that a woman may have ruled there more than 1,300 years ago.

title: Former Seoul Police Chief Acquitted in Halloween Crowd Crush Case
content: Kim Kwang-ho, the former head of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, was the most senior official to face criminal charges over the 2022 disaster that killed 159 people.
summary: Kim Kwang-ho, the former head of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, was the most senior official to face criminal charges over the 2022 disaster that killed 159 people.

title: Mexico’s Ex-Security Chief Sentenced to 38 Years for Cartel Bribery
content: The stiff penalty was the potentially final step in the stunning downfall of the former official, Genaro García Luna, who has gone from the heights of power to imprisonment.
summary: The stiff penalty was the potentially final step in the stunning downfall of the former official, Genaro García Luna, who has gone from the heights of power to imprisonment.

title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar Was Killed After a Surprise Battlefield Encounter

title: David Lammy, U.K. Foreign Secretary, Visits China in Bid to Reset Relations

title: Behind Nigeria’s Fuel Tanker Explosion, a Fatal Quest for Cheap Gasoline
content: More than 160 people died when an overturned fuel tanker in northern Nigeria exploded. Witnesses and relatives of victims said poverty had driven most to try to collect the spilled gas.

title: Thomas J. Donohue Dies at 86; Transformed Chamber of Commerce

title: Fuel Tanker Explosion Leaves at Least 150 Dead in Nigeria
content: Residents of a nearby town went to scoop up gasoline that had spilled from an overturned tanker, but then it exploded, setting off an inferno. Several similar disasters have taken place in recent years.

title: Flying Into Storms Improves Forecasts, but It Is Rare in Asia’s Typhoon Alley
